stems.BSC: (to be) a living being; a life-form; a form of life; to be something that is alive
stems.CTE: (to be) the individual essence/soul, set of instincts, or mind of a life-form (that distinguishes it from other individuals)
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical body or corporeal aspect of a living thing
stems.OBJ: (to be) an entity/party impacted/affected by the presence of, or interaction with a living being

stems: (to be) something vital; manifest vitality; activity consistent with being alive
(to be) something reproduced or brought to life; to reproduce [biologically], bring to life
non-plant / non-animal eukaryote, [i.e., protist, fungus, or chromist]
protist [i.e., protozoa, amoeboids, protophytic algae, slime molds]
cereal grain or pseudo-cereal grain [e.g., wheat, rice, buckwheat, amaranth, etc.]
eusporangiate fern [e.g., whisk fern, grapefern, horsetail, adder’s tongue]
lycopod [e.g., club moss, firmoss, spike moss, quillwort]
lizard-like reptile [e.g., lizard, skink, gecko, monitor]
Gymnophione (caecilian) amphibian [i.e., snake-like or worm-like amphibian]
motile, free-swimming waterlife form, e.g., fish, eels, whales, octopus, etc.
crawling waterlife form, e.g., crustaceans, crabs
non-motile/sessile waterlife form, e.g., shellfish, sea urchin, starfish, etc.
bivalve [e.g., clam, mussel, scallop, oyster, cockle, etc.]
other non-cephalopod mollusc [e.g., nautilus, chiton, solenogaster, etc.]
worm [i.e., annelid worm or nematode worm]
cephalopod [e.g., octopus, squid, cuttlefish, argonaut, etc.]
cnidarian, ctenophore, or placozoan [e.g., jellyfish, coral, sea anemone, hydra, comb jelly, etc.]
hexapod or chelicerate [i.e., insect or arachnid, including springtail, conehead, dipluran, horseshoe crab, and sea spider]
spider or harvester (a.k.a. harvestman or daddy longlegs)
scorpion or solifuge (a.k.a. wind scorpion, camel spider, sun spider)
beetle or beetle-like insect (in terms of appearance/behavior)
ant or ant-like insect (in terms of behavior/appearance)
rounded “bug”-like insect other than beetle [e.g., bed bug, stink bug, junebug, etc.]
bee, bumblebee or bee-like insect (in terms of appearance/behavior)
wasp, hornet, sawfly, or wasp-like insect (in terms of appearance/behavior)
gnat / midge / mosquito or similar insect (in terms of appearance/behavior)
fly or fly-like insect (in terms of appearance/behavior)
louse, aphid, thrip or similar insect (in terms of behavior/appearance)
lacewing or lacewing-like insect (in terms of appearance/behavior), e.g., stonefly, alderfly, fishfly, antlion, owlfly, etc.
harmful [i.e., parasitic, pathogenic or poisonous] fungus/mushroom

stems.BSC: (to be) a newborn, newly hatched, newly sprouted, first-stage life-form [e.g., sprout, larva, tadpole, caterpillar, gametophyte, sporophyte, etc.]
stems.CTE: (to be) the individual essence/soul, set of instincts, or mind of a first-stage life-form (that distinguishes it from other individuals)
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical body or corporeal aspect of a first-stage life-form
stems.OBJ: (to be) an entity/party impacted/affected by the presence of, or interaction with a first-stage life-form

stems.BSC: (to be) the pupal stage of a metamorphic life-form
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of metamorphosis undergone by a pupa
stems.CSV: (to be) a pupa, i.e., a life-form in a pupal stage of development

stems.BSC: (to be) the “birth” or hatching of a life-form from a cocoon, chrysalis, external (shell-bearing) egg, or other interim metamorphic life-stage; to hatch, emerge from a cocoon, emerge from a marsupial pouch, etc.
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of having completed a metamorphic life-stage and becoming one’s final corporeal form
stems.CSV: (to be) the process of hatching/emerging itself
stems.OBJ: (to be) the discarded cocoon, egg-casing, bud, etc. emerged from
